newsitem.title: USA: Ballot questions and bond referendums by state.
newsitem.headline: Ballot questions and bond referendums by state.

text.p: The following is a list of upcoming ballot initiatives and measures affecting municipal finance.
P - passed. D - defeated. NA - not available.
--Marion County, half-cent sales tax increase for schools.
--Miami referendum on whether the city should be dissolved and absorbed into the Metro-Dade County government.
--Miami referendum on whether to adopt strong-mayor and single-member commission district form of government.
--Brevard County referendum on whether to refund controversial 1989 COPs issue.
--Effingham County, five-year extension of one-cent special purpose tax for infrastructure projects.
--Effingham County, one-cent sales tax for schools.
--Oconee County, one-cent sales tax for schools.
--Savannah-Chatham County one-cent sales tax hike for schools.
--DuPage County referendum to approve $75 million of GO bonds to buy 2,200 acres of open space.
--$5.75 million Cresskill, N.J., school bonds to renovate two elementary schools.
--$20 million bond referendum to finance demolition of abandoned and dilapidated buildings in urban areas.
--$98 million Cumberland County school GO bonds.
--$500 million Mecklenburg County GO bonds for schools and jails.
--$125 million New Hanover County GO bonds for schools.
--$38.8 million New Hanover County GO bonds for Cape Fear Community College.
--$25 million Alamance County school GO bonds.
--Statewide referendum on a "homestead exemption" constitutional amendment, which would allow local governments to exempt homeowners from the property tax.
--Allegheny County, Pa., voters decide ballot question that would change county government from a three-member committee to a government comprised of an executive and unpaid county council.
--Ten Western Pennsylvania counties vote on proposed half-percent sales tax increase to build a new professional baseball stadium in Pittsburgh and expand the city's convention center.
-- The following list is of subdivisions submitting bond issues at the Aug. 5th special elections.
--$11 million Hamilton City SD in Butler County for site improvements.
--$3 million London City/Madison County for road improvements.
--$33.5 million Nordonia Hills City SD/ Summit County for improving school sites.
--$42.934 million Perrysburgh Ex. Yg. SD/Wood County for improving school sites.
--$19.890 million Plain Local SD/Franklin County for site improvements.
--$5.6 million Tiffin City SD/Seneca County for site improvements.

--5.75 mills Forest Hills Local SD/Hamilton County
--8.0 mills Hopewell Loudon Local SD/Seneca County
--8.35 mills Mt. Healthy City SD/Hamilton County

--5.9 mills Reading Community Local SD/Hamilton County

The following is a list of municipalities submitting income tax questions.
--Cleveland residents vote on initiative to require businesses granted property tax abatements, or the city, to reimburse public schools for lost revenues.
--$109.6 million Georgetown County GOs for schools.
--$73.3 million Loudoun County school bond issue for school contruction and renovations.
--Statewide referendum on constitutional amendment allowing equity investment of public funds.
--$98 million of Kanawha County school GOs.
--Renewal of Kanawha County excess levy to raise $9.93 million a year for bus and ambulance services.
